channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: CRCC Internship Fair to be Held November 14
item.description: Still searching for a spring or summer internship? Planning to stay local? CRCC is hosting its 8th annual Internship Fair, which will be held from noon until 3:00PM on Thursday, November 14 and is open to RPI students of all majors. Employers will be hiring from various industries, so be sure to register in Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: Industry Evening with Lally School of Management to be Held November 13
item.description: Join the CCPD and the Lally School of Management from 5:30PM to 8:00PM on Wednesday, November 13 in the Russell Sage Banquet Hall for an evening of professional networking and recruiting conversation surrounding careers in the financial services, business, and management consulting industries. Register in Handshake today!
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Offer Mechanical Engineering Review
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work faculty as they cover Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Participants can expect to learn how professionals can develop their practice in core mechanical disciplines while being able to customize the program to fit their needs.
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring 2025 Arch Away Registration to be Held November 20
item.description: Do you have your Spring 2025 Arch Away registered? If you need help discussing your opportunities, reviewing application materials, or discussing other options, stop by the CCPD on November 20 between 1 and 3 PM!
item.author: Students

item.title: Register For HackRPI!
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 9, 2024 - Sun , November 10, 2024 (all day) - This year’s HackRPI will be in the Institute’s 11th annual hackathon, so we want to make sure that as many people know about it as possible! The event will be held in the DCC for participants to hack, eat food, and meet our sponsors. Register now!
item.author: Students

item.title: Virtual Info Session to Highlight Accelerated Engineering/Science + MBA Program
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 13, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Are you interested in saving time and money by getting your MBA in an accelerated program? Register to attend this session to learn more about the new Accelerated Engineering/Science + MBA Program, which allows Rensselaer engineering and science undergraduates to complete their Bachelor’s degree within eight or fewer semesters.

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgraded to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. This is the final upgrade prior to the start of the semester, and brings in increased stability and features for utilizing Webex within a course in Blackboard. Please refer to the ITSSC Knowledge Base for more information.

item.title: “Ethics: Some Finer Points” Discussion Scheduled for November 8
item.description: Date: Friday, November 8, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - When faced with an ethical issue in our work, we typically first make sure we understand the issue, then often seek guidance in our engineering specialty’s code of ethics, make a decision, and implement it. Register to join Prof. Azita Hirsa and Stuart G. Walesh, Ph.D., P.E. (ret) for this insightful discussion!…

item.title: Computer Science Colloquium Slated for November 11
item.description: Date: Monday, November 11, 2024 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - In this colloquium, Nikos Vasilakis, of Brown University, will present “Scaling out Shell Programs, Automatically.”

item.title: Rensselaer Professor Selected as Fellow of the Association for Women in Mathematics
item.description: Rensselaer’s Fengyan Li, Ph.D., professor of mathematical sciences, has been selected as a 2025 Fellow of the Association for Women in Mathematics (AWM). AWM Fellows demonstrate a sustained commitment “to encourage women and girls to study and to have active careers in the mathematical sciences, and to promote equal opportunity and the equal treatment of women and girls in the mathematical sciences.”

item.title: Enjoy the Festival of Lights at RPI Diwali Night 2024!
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 9, 2024 5:00 PM - 10:00 PM - Register to join the Graduate Indian Students Association for an evening of vibrant performances, lively music, dance, a cultural fashion show, a delicious Indian buffet, and much more!…

item.title: Rensselaer Geochemist Honored with Lifetime Achievement Award
item.description: Rensselaer’s Frank Spear, Ph.D., professor of earth and environmental sciences and Edward Hamilton Distinguished Educator Chair, is the 2024 recipient of the Walter H. Bucher Medal from the American Geophysical Union (AGU). Presented annually to a “senior scientist in recognition of original contributions to the basic knowledge of crust and lithosphere,” the medal is considered a recognition of lifetime achievement.
item.author: Community

item.title: HR to Hold “Discovering and Leveraging Your Talents” Professional Development Workshop
item.description:
Date: Monday, November 11, 2024 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Are you interested in learning more about options available to advance your career at Rensselaer? In this workshop, participants will learn about the Institute’s current job family structure and how positions are placed within it, join an active discussion about the tools that are available to assist in advancing one’s career, and hear from current employees about their experiences and suggestions.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
